item.title: Republicans Now Control Obamacare. Will Your Coverage Change?
item.description: April 10, 2017 - There are many ways beyond legislative repeal that the Trump administration and congressional Republicans could undo the Affordable Care Act — starting with sowing uncertainty about what's next.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 10, 2017 - There are many ways beyond legislative repeal that the Trump administration and congressional Republicans could undo the Affordable Care Act — starting with sowing uncertainty about what's next. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/10/523020561/republicans-now-control-obamacare-will-your-coverage-change

item.title: Drugs That Work In Mice Often Fail When Tried In People
item.description: April 10, 2017 - Most potential new drugs don't work when tested in people. It's a major disappointment and it drives up the cost of developing new drugs. One big reason is the use of animals in medical research.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 10, 2017 - Most potential new drugs don't work when tested in people. It's a major disappointment and it drives up the cost of developing new drugs. One big reason is the use of animals in medical research. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/10/522775456/drugs-that-work-in-mice-often-fail-when-tried-in-people

item.title: How Playing Tetris Tames The Trauma Of A Car Crash
item.description: April 9, 2017 - Researchers were able to dial down painful recollections of a car crash by having people play the video game Tetris while in the emergency room. The technique makes use of the malleability of memory.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 9, 2017 - Researchers were able to dial down painful recollections of a car crash by having people play the video game Tetris while in the emergency room. The technique makes use of the malleability of memory. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/09/523011446/how-playing-tetris-tames-the-trauma-of-a-car-crash

item.title: Fresh Express Recalls Batch After Dead Bat Found In Prepackaged Salad
item.description: April 9, 2017 - Federal health officials are investigating the case, after a couple of Florida salad eaters stumbled upon a perhaps too organic spring mix purchased at Walmart.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 9, 2017 - Federal health officials are investigating the case, after a couple of Florida salad eaters stumbled upon a perhaps too organic spring mix purchased at Walmart. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/09/523154228/fresh-express-issues-recall-after-dead-bat-reportedly-found-in-prepackaged-salad

item.title: When Gluten Is The Villain, Could A Common Virus Be The Trigger?
item.description: April 8, 2017 - About 30 percent of Americans are predisposed to celiac disease, but only 1 percent get the disease. A new study finds that a common virus may play a role in determining who gets the disease.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 8, 2017 - About 30 percent of Americans are predisposed to celiac disease, but only 1 percent get the disease. A new study finds that a common virus may play a role in determining who gets the disease. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/04/08/523002516/when-gluten-is-the-villain-could-a-common-virus-be-the-trigger

item.title: A Baby With 3 Genetic Parents Seems Healthy, But Questions Remain
item.description: April 8, 2017 - A baby who was conceived through an experimental procedure designed to prevent a deadly disease appears to be healthy. But some potentially defective DNA remains. Will it affect his health long term?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 8, 2017 - A baby who was conceived through an experimental procedure designed to prevent a deadly disease appears to be healthy. But some potentially defective DNA remains. Will it affect his health long term? http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/08/523020895/a-baby-with-3-genetic-parents-seems-healthy-but-questions-remain

item.title: Pork Tacos Topped With Fries: Fuel For Mexico's Diabetes Epidemic
item.description: April 8, 2017 - Mexico knows how to fight infectious diseases. Tackling a chronic condition like diabetes is a new — and daunting — challenge.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 8, 2017 - Mexico knows how to fight infectious diseases. Tackling a chronic condition like diabetes is a new — and daunting — challenge. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/04/08/522184483/pork-tacos-topped-with-fries-fuel-for-mexicos-diabetes-epidemic

item.title: Postal Service Reports Increase In Dog Attacks On Letter Carriers
item.description: April 7, 2017 - The USPS said its employees were bitten in 6,755 attacks in 2016, and Los Angeles topped the list, with 80. The postal service also released safety tips.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 7, 2017 - The USPS said its employees were bitten in 6,755 attacks in 2016, and Los Angeles topped the list, with 80. The postal service also released safety tips. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/04/07/523062846/postal-service-reports-increase-in-dog-attacks-on-letter-carriers

item.title: As Measles Surges In Europe, Officials Brace For A Rough Year
item.description: April 7, 2017 - If you're traveling this spring, be sure you're vaccinated. 2017 is shaping to be bad year for the measles, with thousands of cases in Italy and Romania. And vaccine coverage is stagnating worldwide.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 7, 2017 - If you're traveling this spring, be sure you're vaccinated. 2017 is shaping to be bad year for the measles, with thousands of cases in Italy and Romania. And vaccine coverage is stagnating worldwide. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/04/07/522867040/as-measles-surges-in-europe-officials-brace-for-a-rough-year

item.title: FDA Approves Marketing Of Consumer Genetic Tests For Some Conditions
item.description: April 7, 2017 - The company 23andMe is now allowed to market tests that assess genetic risks for 10 health conditions, including Parkinson's and late-onset Alzheimer's diseases.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 7, 2017 - The company 23andMe is now allowed to market tests that assess genetic risks for 10 health conditions, including Parkinson's and late-onset Alzheimer's diseases. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/07/522897473/fda-approves-marketing-of-consumer-genetic-tests-for-some-conditions

item.title: James Hansen: What Makes A Scientist Take A Stand?
item.description: April 7, 2017 - When James Hansen spoke up about climate change in the 1980s, he risked the loss of his job and reputation. But, he says, it was worth it — because he could not be silent about something so important.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 7, 2017 - When James Hansen spoke up about climate change in the 1980s, he risked the loss of his job and reputation. But, he says, it was worth it — because he could not be silent about something so important. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/07/522856713/james-hansen-what-makes-a-scientist-take-a-stand

item.title: In Diabetes Fight, Lifestyle Changes Prove Hard To Come By In Mexico
item.description: April 7, 2017 - To curb diabetes, Mexico is trying to get people to cut down on soda, eat more healthful foods and exercise. But changing people's habits is easier said than done.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 7, 2017 - To curb diabetes, Mexico is trying to get people to cut down on soda, eat more healthful foods and exercise. But changing people's habits is easier said than done. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/04/07/522596080/in-diabetes-fight-lifestyle-changes-prove-hard-to-come-by-in-mexico

item.title: Bison Or Brian? From A Calorie Perspective, Cannibalism Didn't Pay For Paleo Humans
item.description: April 6, 2017 - Archaeological records show ancient humans sometimes ate each other. A new study suggests that hunting and eating other humans cost too much effort to be a regular thing. So why'd they do it?
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 6, 2017 - Archaeological records show ancient humans sometimes ate each other. A new study suggests that hunting and eating other humans cost too much effort to be a regular thing. So why'd they do it? http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/04/06/522880018/what-s-the-dietary-value-of-a-human

item.title: CDC Issues New Warning On Zika Virus Ahead Of Mosquito Season
item.description: April 6, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks to Margaret Honein, co-leader for the CDC Zika Response Team's Pregnancy and Birth Defects Task Force, about the latest guidance on Zika at the start of mosquito season.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 6, 2017 - NPR's Robert Siegel talks to Margaret Honein, co-leader for the CDC Zika Response Team's Pregnancy and Birth Defects Task Force, about the latest guidance on Zika at the start of mosquito season. http://www.npr.org/2017/04/06/522903447/cdc-issues-new-warning-on-zika-virus-ahead-of-mosquito-season

item.title: In Giant Virus Genes, Hints About Their Mysterious Origin
item.description: April 6, 2017 - They're the Godzillas of the virus world, pushing the limit of what is considered alive. Researchers are trying to figure out where they came from. (And no, they aren't known to make people sick.)
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: April 6, 2017 - They're the Godzillas of the virus world, pushing the limit of what is considered alive. Researchers are trying to figure out where they came from. (And no, they aren't known to make people sick.) http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/04/06/522478901/in-giant-virus-genes-hints-about-their-mysterious-origin
